text: A refugee camp was the target of an air strike in South Sudan's Unity state on Thursday, less than 50 km (30 miles) from the tense border with Sudan, a Reuters witness said.  There appeared to be no casualties.  The Reuters correspondent heard a large explosion, then saw a crater about two metres (6. 6 feet) wide, an unexploded bomb wedged in the side of a school building and a white aircraft flying north from the Yida refugee camp.  Witnesses at the camp said there were three other explosions at 3 p. m. (1200 GMT).
title: Plane bombs South Sudan refugee camp - witness.
